skills.name: Learning and Enthusiasm
skills.description: Ability to learn quickly and show genuine interest in the role

skills.name: Special Skills
skills.description: Technical expertise and relevant domain knowledge

skills.name: Professionalism
skills.description: Work ethic, reliability, and professional conduct

interviewSummary: The candidate introduced themselves as Binh, a .NET developer with 3 years of experience in Web API.
The interviewer greeted the candidate and asked how their day was going.
The candidate explained their experience working in an Agile team, emphasizing Scrum and daily standups.
They demonstrated strong communication skills when discussing team collaboration with QA and PM.
Provided a clear comparison between REST API and GraphQL, highlighting advantages and trade-offs.
Successfully designed a scalable order management system using Microservices and RabbitMQ for communication.
Discussed SQL query optimization strategies, including indexing, partitioning, and caching with Redis.
Explained the Repository Pattern and its benefits in separating data access from business logic.
Proposed an effective approach to handling high API traffic using Rate Limiting, CDN caching, and Load Balancers.
While the technical responses were strong, the candidate could further elaborate on practical implementation challenges.
Displayed enthusiasm for the role and conveyed a solid understanding of modern software architecture.
Gave structured and logical responses, breaking down complex problems into smaller, solvable steps.
Successfully shared past project experiences but could improve by including quantifiable impact metrics.
feedback: Clear understanding of system design and database optimization.
Enthusiastic and knowledgeable about modern software practices.
Could add more real-world implementation details.
Overall strong performance with minor areas for improvement.
suggestions: Provide more real-world implementation examples to enhance clarity.
Expand on past project experiences with measurable impact metrics.
Improve depth in system design discussions by detailing scalability considerations.
Refine API architecture explanations with specific use cases and trade-offs.
Strengthen database optimization strategies with practical performance insights.
Demonstrate a more structured approach to breaking down complex problems.
Enhance responses by incorporating industry best practices and patterns.
